{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is 20 weeks pregnant and is experiencing vaginal bleeding. The speculum examination reveals an open os, but no products of conception have been expelled. This suggests that the pregnancy is at risk, but not yet completely lost. According to Document [16], in a threatened abortion, the vaginal exam may reveal a closed cervical os with no tissue. However, in this case, the os is open. Document [10] describes an inevitable abortion as vaginal bleeding with an open cervical os and viable pregnancy.
